title: Amiri Decision No. (38) of 2022 on the Organizational Structure of the Ministry of Justice
title_en: Amiri Decision No. (38) of 2022 on the Organizational Structure of the Ministry of Justice
short_name: Amiri Decision No. (38) of 2022 on the Organizational Structure of the Ministry of Justice
description: Official legislation text retrieved from Al Meezan Legal Portal (English laws list source).

provisions.title: Article (1)
provisions.content:
Administrative units of the Minister:
The Minister's Office.
The Technical Office.
The Internal Audit Department.
The Planning, Quality and Innovation Department.
The Legal Affairs Department.

provisions.title: Article (2)
provisions.content:
The Technical Office shall be specialized in the following:
Expressing technical opinion on issues referred to it by the Minister.
Studying and evaluating reports, projects and programs related to the Ministry's activities, which are referred to by the Minister.
Researching, studying and following-up on issues referred to it by the Minister, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Preparing a summary of the topics, reports and studies that need to be presented to the Minister, and expressing an opinion on them.

provisions.title: Article (3)
provisions.content:
The Internal Audit Department shall be specialized in the following:
Preparing the draft annual risk-based audit plan for the Ministry, submitting it to the Minister for approval, and preparing reports on the results of the audit.
Monitoring the extent of compliance with the implementation of laws, regulations and decisions regulating work.
Reviewing financial instructions, proposing the necessary amendments, and monitoring their implementation.
Monitoring administrative works and procedures for employees' appointment, their vacations, promotions, and other matters related to personnel, and verifying compliance with the laws, regulations, and regulating decisions.
Monitoring financial and accounting works, exchange vouchers, and registration procedures in the accounting records, and ensuring that the approved rules are applied in this regard.
Evaluating the risks related to financial and administrative auditing and proposing measures to reduce them.
Following up the corrective actions required by the concerned administrative units, according to the results of the audit, and preparing periodic reports thereon .
Ensuring the safety of funds, trust, furniture, tools, buildings and other assets owned by the Ministry or that are subject to its supervision.
Participating in periodic and sudden inventory work on stores and custody and ensuring the accuracy of registration in the booksand the integrity of the applied procedures.
Following up on the results of the oversight bodies' reports and making appropriate recommendations thereon.

provisions.title: Article (4)
provisions.content:
The Planning, Quality and Innovation Department shall be specialized in the following:
Preparing the Ministry's strategic plan, in coordination with the competent bodies and concerned administrative units and taking procedures for itsapproval.
Listing the existing challenges, identifying and evaluating the expected institutional risks that may affect the achievement of the Ministry's objectives, and submitting proposals regarding them, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Managing and preparing alternative plans to ensure the continuity of operating the Ministry's works in emergencies and crises, in coordination with the various administrative units, each in its own jurisdiction.
Submitting draft executive plans, projects and programs of the various administrative units, for approval by the Minister.
Following up the implementation of plans related to the Ministry's activities, evaluating their results, and submitting periodic reports thereon .
Studying the problems and obstacles facing the implementation of the strategic plan and operational plans and proposing appropriate solutions.
Evaluation of the quality of services provided by the administrative units, in coordination with the competent authority.
Reviewing and evaluating the quality of performance at the level of administrative units and making proposals to raise their general efficiency.
Verifying the compatibility of systems and methods of work with competences and objectives of the Ministry, proposing plans to develop those systems and methods, and simplifying procedures, in coordination with the concerned administrative units and the competent body.
Studying the problems and obstacles of the work in the Ministry, discussing their causes, and proposing appropriate solutions.
Receiving creative initiatives, proposals and ideas, and studying them in coordination with the concerned administrative units and the competent body.
Monitoring, collecting and analyzing statistical data related to the Ministry's activities, and coordinating with the competent administrative units regarding the statistical reports required by the Ministry.
Coordinating with the concerned administrative units and the competent body with regard to international indicators related to the activities and competences of the Ministry.

provisions.title: Article (5)
provisions.content:
The Legal Affairs Department shall be specialized in the following:
Research, study and follow-up on legal issues related to the Ministry's activities, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Preparing draft legislative tools for the Ministry and expressing an opinion on draft laws referred thereto .
Expressing a legal opinion on the issues referred thereto .
Preparing draft contracts, agreements and memorandums of understanding related to the Ministry's competencies, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Investigating the incidents and violations attributed to the Ministry's employees, preparing the necessary memoranda on the results of the investigation, accompanied by legal opinion and recommendations, presenting them to the competent body, and following up on the implementation of decisions taken in this regard.

provisions.title: Article (6)
provisions.content:
The Center for Legal and Judicial Studies shall be specialized in the following:
Training judges, members of the Public Prosecution Office, their assistants and jurists in government bodies, to develop and update their capabilities, scientific and applied skills.
Training judges' assistants and judicial police officers, to ensure the development of their scientific skills and capabilities to perform the duties entrusted to them.
Training lawyers and trainee lawyers.
Preparing qualified persons for appointment in the positions of the Judiciary and the Public Prosecution, who are nominated by the Supreme Judicial Council or the Public Prosecutor.
Developing and deepening scientific research in the legal and judicial fields for trainees, holding seminars and meetings and issuing legal magazines and periodicals.
Preparing and updating course curricula and legal and judicial training plans.
Implementing training programs of all kinds, in coordination with members of the training authorities.
Coordinating with the concerned authorities to which candidates for the training are affiliated.
Spreading and developing legal awareness among the various segments of society, encouraging initiatives and research in this field and holding awareness workshops.

provisions.title: Article (7)
provisions.content:
The Attorney Affairs Department shall be specialized in the following:
Listing of lawyers who have been accepted by the Lawyers Admission Committee.
Classifying and registering lawyers and law firms according to the schedules issued by a decision of the Minister.
Collecting registration fees of lawyers and law firms.
Preparing an integrated database of lawyers and law firms.
Processing data and topics related to the work of the Lawyers Admission Committee.
Investigating lawyers in disciplinary violations, filing a disciplinary case, representing the prosecution before the Disciplinary Council, and challenging its decisions, in accordance with the provisions of the Advocacy Law.

provisions.title: Article (8)
provisions.content:
The Public Relations and Communication Department shall be specialized in the following:
Issuing bulletins and media programs aimed at introducing the Ministry's role, activities and specializations, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Monitoring and following up on issues related to the Ministry and its specializations published in newspapers, media and social media, presenting them to officials and preparing appropriate responses, in coordination with the concerned administrative units and the competent authorities.
Coordination with the competent administrative units regarding the preparation of awareness and education plans and programs, and their application through various events and activities, in coordination with the concerned authorities.
Receiving requests and complaints of clients, referring them to the concerned administrative units, and responding to their inquiries.
Making travel, hospitality and accommodation arrangements for the Ministry's guests and visiting and departing delegations, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Organizing cultural, social and sports activities for the Ministry's employees, and supervising celebrations held or participated by the Ministry.
Organizing conferences, seminars and exhibitions held by the Ministry, and preparing the necessary budget, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Receiving requests from the elderly and people with disabilities, in coordination with the competent administrative units, to complete their transactions and overcome any problems or difficulties they may encounter.

provisions.title: Article (9)
provisions.content:
The Anti-Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing Unit shall be specialized in the following:
Following up the implementation of the provisions of legislation related to combating money laundering and terrorism financing, and proposing relevant legislative amendments, in connection with the Ministry's competencies, and in the light of international recommendations and the results of mutual evaluations and best practices.
Following up and coordination with the National Anti-Money Laundering and Terrorism Financing committee, providing it with the data and information it requests, and participating with it in completing the national assessment of the risks of money laundering, financing terrorism and financing the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction within the Ministry’s field of competence, and implementing its outputs.
Preparing sectoral assessments of the risks of money laundering, terrorism financing and financing the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction for designated non-financial businesses and professions subject to its control, supervising their implementation, analyzing, documenting, disseminating and updating their results, in coordination with the National Anti-Money Laundering and Terrorism Financing Committee.
Coordinating with the National Anti-Terrorism Committee in all matters relating to targeted financial sanctions and persons included in the sanctions list.
Collecting and classifying data related to anti- money laundering and terrorism financing within the Ministry’s field of competence, establishing a database and updating it periodically, analyzing results, and drawing indicators in this regard.
Preparing instructions, rules, guidelines, recommendations and guiding principles necessary to combat money laundering and terrorism financing and directing them to lawyers, authorized notaries and real estate brokers subject to the supervision of the Ministry.
Providing the necessary training programs in the field of combating money laundering and terrorism financing, in order to develop the capabilities of lawyers, authorized notaries, real estate brokers and holders of relevant positions in the Ministry, in coordination with the Training Center of the National Anti-Money Laundering and Terrorism Financing Committee.
Controlling, following-up and supervising of lawyers, authorized notaries and real estate brokers to ensure their compliance with the requirements of combating money laundering and terrorism financing in accordance with the provisions of the law, and access to documents and information they have, when necessary, to carry out control activities.
Suggesting financial and administrative penalties against lawyers, authorized notaries and real estate brokers proven to be in violation of the provisions of the Anti-Money Laundering and Terrorism Financing Law and its Executive Regulations, and any relevant decisions or directives, and informing the Financial Information Unit of the actions taken in this regard.
Cooperating with the competent authorities, supervisory authorities and the Financial Information Unit, and exchanging information among them, in order to implement the requirements of the Anti-Money Laundering and Terrorism Financing Law, its Executive Regulations and all relevant decisions or directives, and to establish the necessary procedures for reporting suspicious transactions.
Representing the Ministry in national, regional and international meetings and activities concerned with combating money laundering and terrorist financing.
Preparing an annual report on the Ministry's activity in the field of combating money laundering, financing terrorism and financing the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction, including proposals and recommendations in this regard, and submitting it to the National

provisions.title: Article (10)
provisions.content:
The State Cases Department shall be specialized in the following:
Acting on behalf of the government authorities in the State, in the claims or appeals filed by them or against them before the various courts or other authorities authorized by the law to practise the judicial competence.
Acting on behalf of the government authorities in the State, in the claims filed by them or against them before the local or international arbitration tribunals.
Following-up the implementation of the verdicts issued in favor of the authorities on behalf of which it is acting.
Contracting with the lawyers to initiate some of the lawsuits which fall under its competence, after the approval of the Minister, and upon the presentation of the Undersecretary of the Ministry whenever nature of the case requires so.
Deciding on filing the claims or appeals against the verdicts issued against the State. If the Department considers not to file the case or not to appeal against verdict, the concerned administrative authority shall not violate the opinion of the Department except by a reasoned decision of the Minister or the competent head.
Expressing opinion on the request for reconciliation or settlement in the cases initiated by the Department and the concerned authority shall not make a reconciliation or settlement except after taking the opinion of the Department and approval of the Minister. The Department may propose to the concerned authority the reconciliation or settlement in a lawsuit initiated by the Department.
Following up disputes and cases to which the Ministry is a party, in coordination with the competent authorities.

provisions.title: Article (11)
provisions.content:
The Contracts Department shall be specialized in the following:
Reviewing the draft contracts that the government authorities intend to conclude and expressing opinions on the issues that result from the implementation of such contracts, in accordance with the laws and regulations in force.
Publishing the legislative instruments and issuing the Official Gazette.
Adopting the translation of laws, regulations and decisions.

provisions.title: Article (12)
provisions.content:
The Agreements and International Cooperation Department shall be specialized in the following:
Studying and reviewing the draft international agreements and the like, which are referred by the competent authorities, and inserting its amendments thereto.
Studying the financial costs, revenues and obligations of the State resulting from the draft international agreements intended to be concluded.
Preparing the draft agreements of legal and judicial cooperation and the like, in coordination with the competent authorities, and following up their implementation.
Preparing a database on international agreements.
Following up the renewal of the international agreements, in coordination with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the competent authorities.
Expressing the opinion on the dispute referred to it relating to the interpretation or implementation of the international agreements and the like.
Preparing the paperwork related to the local, regional and international conferences, seminars and meetings, regarding the Ministry's activity, in coordination with the concerned administrative units and the competent authorities.
Preparing the reports and responses required by the regional and international organizations, federations and bodies regarding the Ministry's activity, in coordination with the concerned administrative units, and following-up the recommendations issued thereof, in coordination with the competent authorities in the State.
Following-up the payment of financial contributions to the State in organizations concerned with the fields of work of the Ministry and of which the State is a member, in coordination with the competent authorities.
Preparing the necessary reports on the efficiency and effectiveness of international cooperation with the regional and international organizations and bodies regarding the Ministry's activity.
Translating documents, books, scientific research and foreign correspondence related to the Ministry's specialization.

provisions.title: Article (13)
provisions.content:
The Expert Department shall be specialized in the following:
Providing technical expertise in the fields of engineering, accounting, translation, and any other fields or specializations determined by the Minister.
Maintaining a list for the registration of experts in different disciplines and classifying them in sub-lists.
Receiving requests for registration in the experts' registration list and requests for its renewal, along with the supporting documents, and registering them in the register prepared for this purpose, according to the order of their receipt and handing the applicant the receipt indicating that.
Presenting applications for registration in the experts' registration list, together with their comments, to the Committee of Experts' Affairs.
Enrolling experts whom the Committee of Experts Affairs approves of their registration or renewal of their registration in the experts' registration list.
Following up on the collection of prescribed fees for registration or renewal of registration in the experts' registration list.
Receiving and recording notifications of roster experts to stop practicing expert work and receiving requests to re-practice the activity.
Receiving complaints against experts, notifying the defendants thereof, and taking legally prescribed procedures in their regard.
Implementing the disciplinary decisions issued by the Experts’ Affairs Committee, including them in the register prepared for this purpose and noting accordingly in the experts’ registration list.
Receiving requests for assistance from experts who are not registered in the list, to provide expertise in a specific case or in a specific technical subject that requires rare and specialized expertise, and taking the legally prescribed procedures in this regard.
Providing the Supreme Judicial Council, the Public Prosecution and the concerned authorities with the names of the experts registered in the experts' registration list, their qualifications and areas of expertise, and any changes that may occur in their regard.
Proposing training plans for experts, and following up on their implementation, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Conducting the necessary studies and research to develop the provision of expert work, and proposing appropriate solutions to the problems and obstacles it faces.

provisions.title: Article (14)
provisions.content:
The Arbitration Affairs Department shall be specialized in the following:
Receiving and studying applications for registration in the arbitrators’ registry, and requests for its renewal, and submitting them to the Minister for decision.
Receiving and studying applications for licensing and renewing a license to establish arbitration centers and branches of foreign arbitration centers within the State, and submitting them to the Minister for decision.
Preparing special records and a database for arbitrators, arbitration centers and branches of foreign arbitration centers licensed to operate in the State.
Collecting fees for registration and renewal of registration in the Arbitrators Register, and fees for issuing and renewing licenses for arbitration centers and branches of foreign arbitration centers.
Receiving electronic copies of arbitral awards or decisions ending the dispute, in accordance with the regulating law.
Preparing the necessary studies to develop the arbitration system in the State, in coordination with the concerned authorities.

provisions.title: Article (15)
provisions.content:
The Real Estate Registration Department shall be specialized in the following:
Registering the properties in the real estate sheets.
Registering transactions and final judgments submitted to the Department in the real estate register.
Documenting all works related to real estate registration.
Regulating title deeds and certificates of rights in rem.
Providing data and copies of the registration documents.
Supervising everything related to the real estate registration process.

provisions.title: Article (16)
provisions.content:
The Documentation Department shall be specialized in the following:
Receiving and documenting documents.
Recording of official documents in the books prepared for therein.
Organizing contracts and official documents, and attesting signatures.
Attesting the signatures of the concerned parties in customary documents and proving the date thereof.
Registering private institutions of public interest in the register prepared for that purpose and taking procedures to declare and publish them in the Official Gazette, in coordination with the competent administrative unit.
Accepting and submitting of notarized documents before foreign authorities.
Accepting and submitting of documents related to wills and other dispositions added to after death, and ratification thereof.
Placing the enforcement formula on the copies of the official documents that must be enforced.
Preserving and archiving the originals of documented instruments.
Handing over to the concerned parties a copy of the required documented documents.
Providing the concerned parties with certificates that include attestation of signatures, or proof of date for customary documents, upon request.

provisions.title: Article (17)
provisions.content:
The Real Estate Brokerage Department shall be specialized in the following:
Receiving applications for real estate brokerage licenses, its renewal and deciding on them, in accordance with the provisions of the law.
Issuing licenses to practice real estate brokerage works, renewing them, and collecting the prescribed fees.
Handing over to licensees the cards for practicing real estate brokerage work.
Keeping records of real estate brokers and registering those licensed to practice real estate brokerage business in those records.
Taking the prescribed procedures regarding the assignment and transfer of real estate brokerage licenses and verify fulfilment of legally prescribed conditions.
Receiving real estate brokers' reports regarding the loss, destruction, or damage of any of the books, documents, contracts, or papers that shall be legally retrained, and taking legally prescribed actions in this regard.
Implementing the decisions of the Real Estate Brokers Affairs Committee issued in accordance with the provisions of the law.
Taking measures to suspend or cancel real estate brokerage licenses, in accordance with the provisions of the law.
Notifying the concerned parties of the decisions and procedures taken by the Department, in accordance with the provisions of the law.
Preparing a database on real estate brokers, real estate brokerage and other activities subject to the provisions of the law.
Conducting the necessary studies to develop the real estate brokerage work, and proposing appropriate solutions to the problems and obstacles faced thereon.

provisions.title: Article (18)
provisions.content:
The Human Resources Department shall be specialized in the following:
Implementing the laws, regulations and systems related to personnel affairs.
Preparing studies on human resources planning in the Ministry, and specifying/identifying the Ministry's needs of jobs and employees, in coordination with the competent body and the various administrative units.
Preparing a draft description, classification and grading of jobs and following up its implementation and development.
Preparing the draft budget of Chapter One, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Implementing the performance evaluation procedures for employees.
Carrying out the procedures of appointment, transfer, delegation and secondment.
Studying employees’ entitlement to leave in accordance with the law.
Preparing the studies related to the job structure of the Ministry and submitting the necessary proposals for the development of the administrative organization therein.
Specifying the training needs of the Ministry’s employees, in coordination with the various administrative units, following up on their implementation, and evaluating the extent of the utilization thereof.
Taking the necessary measures to allocate government housing and disbursing the furniture allowance to the Ministry’s employees, in coordination with the competent bodies.
Developing and updating databases related to the affairs of the Ministry’s employees.

provisions.title: Article (19)
provisions.content:
The Financial and Administrative Affairs Department shall be specialized in the following:
Implementing the laws, regulations and financial and administrative systems related to the work of the Ministry.
Preparing the Ministry's draft annual budget and its final account, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Providing the needs of the Ministry and its various administrative units in terms of the supplies and equipment necessary to perform the tasks thereof, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Carrying out procurement, tenders and auctions, in accordance with the regulations and rules in force in the State.
Supervising the implementation of the appropriations, and auditing revenue and expenditure accounts.
Receiving, delivering, classifying and recording incoming and outgoing mail.
Organizing the Ministry's archives and keeping documents according to the latest methods.
Preparing exchange documents and all other financial transactions.
Collecting fees and charges for services rendered by the Ministry.
Carrying out all the administrative services work.
Supervision of the Ministry's stores.

provisions.title: Article (20)
provisions.content:
The Information Systems Management shall be specialized in the following:
Preparing plans and policies for the use of computers in the Ministry's activities and following up on their implementation.
Programming, saving, retrieving and developing the information systems and data necessary for the Ministry's activities.
Securing systems, software, networks and information systems infrastructure from the risks of electronic accidents.
Preparing plans to recover from the effects of electronic accidents in the event of their occurrence, or to reduce their occurrence or their escalation, in accordance with the policies and guidelines for information security, in coordination with the competent body.
Providing and maintaining the hardware, software and electronic networks necessary for the automated work systems in the Ministry, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Designing, operating and managing databases and information of various types.
Providing the necessary technical support to users of electronic networks in the Ministry, and training them on the use of systems, programs, computers and their peripherals.
Establishing, following up and updating the Ministry's website on the international information network.

provisions.title: Article (21)
provisions.content: The terms of reference of each of the Minister's Office, the Undersecretary's Office, and the Assistant Undersecretary's Office shall be determined by a decision of the Minister.

provisions.title: Article (22)
provisions.content: By a decision of the Council of Ministers, based on the proposal of the Minister, the organization of the administrative units that make up the Ministry may be amended by addition, deletion, or merger, and to assign and amend the competencies thereof.

provisions.title: Article (23)
provisions.content: By a decision of the Minister, departments in the administrative units that make up the Ministry may be established, canceled or merged, and the competencies thereof may be assigned and amended. The Minister’s decision shall not be effective until it is approved by the Council of Ministers.

provisions.title: Article (24)
provisions.content: The aforementioned Amiri Decision No. (25) of 2014 shall be repealed.

provisions.title: Article (25)
provisions.content:
All Competent Authorities, each within the competencies thereof, shall implement this Decision, and shall come into force from the date of its publication. It shall be published in the Official Gazette.
Tamim Bin Hamad Al Thani
Amir of the State of Qatar
Issued at the Amiri Diwan on: 28/03/1444 (H)
Corresponding to : 24/10/2022 (AD)
